title: Ghost links/hints
content: Can anyone please explain what ghost links/hints in Fontlab are used for? Thanks!
author: Toby

comments.content:
These are hints that are used to control vertical alignment of features that do not involve horizontal stems. The obvious example would be the top and bottom of a _sans serif_ letter I. There is no serif to function as a horizontal stem, and hence nothing to which to link a standard stem hint. Ghost hints are used here to attach the top and bottom of the letter to vertical alignment (blue) zones.
